revision.comment: as per https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2015/08/25/jared-fogle-admitted-to-sex-crimes-against-minors-why-wasnt-he-charged-with-rape/ Jared Fogle was never convicted of statutory rape, and he was never convicted of child molestation - he was convicting of paying minors for sex across state lines and of child pornography (as that's what is in the federal law books)
revision.text:
{{pp|small=yes}} {{Pp-semi-indef}} {{Use mdy dates|date=May 2017}} {{Infobox criminal | image = Jared Fogle (2007).jpg | caption = Fogle in June 2007 | birth_name = Jared Scott Fogle | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1977|08|23}}{{cite book|last=Sheckler Finch|first=Jackie|title=Insider's Guide® To Indianapolis|year=2010|publisher=Morris Book Publishing, LLC|location=[[Guilford, Connecticut]]|type=paperback|page=[https://books.google.com/books?id=nJpXBczpDNcC&pg=PA60 60]|isbn=9780762756735|chapter=The Skinny On Jared|quote=Jared Fogle had no idea the unplanned course his life would take. Born August 23, 1977, in Indianapolis, ...}} | birth_place = [[Indianapolis, Indiana]], U.S. | alma_mater = [[Indiana University]] | occupation = Former television spokesperson/actor | years_active = 1999–2015 | charge = Distribution and receipt of [[child pornography]], [[child sex tourism|traveling to engage in illicit sexual conduct with a minor]] | conviction = November 19, 2015 (guilty plea) | conviction_penalty = 13–15{{frac|2|3}} years in federal prison, lifetime of [[United States federal probation and supervised release|supervised release]], $175,000 fine plus forfeiture of $50,000 (a total of $225,000), and $1.4 million restitution. | conviction_status = Currently incarcerated at the [[Federal Correctional Institution, Englewood]]; earliest possible release date July 11, 2029 | spouse = {{marriage|Elizabeth Christie|October 14, 2001|October 18, 2007|reason=divorced}}
{{marriage|Katie McLaughlin|August 2010|November 16, 2015|reason=divorced}} | children = 2 }} '''Jared Scott Fogle'''"[https://assets.documentcloud.org/documents/2805441/USA-answer-to-Fogle-sentence-appeal.pdf NO.15-3770 UNITED STATES COURT OF APPEALS FOR THE SEVENTH CIRCUIT UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. JARED S. FOGLE, Defendant-Appellant]." p. 2 (PDF p. 7/42). ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|f|oʊ|g|əl}}; born August 23, 1977), also known as "'''the Subway Guy'''", is an American former [[spokesperson]] for [[Subway (restaurant)|Subway]] restaurants who was convicted of sexual offenses against [[Minor (law)|minors]]. After his significant [[weight loss]] attributed to eating Subway sandwiches, Fogle was made a spokesperson for the company's [[advertising campaign]]s from 2000 to 2015. Fogle's tenure with Subway ended after he was investigated for paying for sex with minors and receiving [[child pornography]] in 2015. On August 19, 2015, he agreed to plead guilty in federal court to possessing child pornography and [[Child sex tourism|traveling to pay for sex with minors]]. Fogle formally pleaded guilty to the charges on November 19, 2015, and was sentenced to serve 15 years, 8 months in [[federal prison]], with a minimum of 13 years before becoming eligible for early release.{{Cite news|first = Julie|last = Jargon|title = Jared Fogle Sentenced to 15 1/2 Years in Prison|url = https://www.wsj.com/articles/jared-fogle-to-be-sentenced-thursday-1447942432|work = [[Wall Street Journal]]|publisher=[[Dow Jones & Company]]|location=New York City|date=November 19, 2015|access-date = November 20, 2015|issn = 0099-9660}}{{cite news|first=Rick|last=Callahan|title=Ex-Subway pitchman Fogle gets more than 15 years in prison |url=http://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/ex-subway-pitchman-fogle-gets-more-than-15-years-in-prison/ar-BBnbVwj |work=[[MSN]] |date=November 19, 2015 |access-date=July 12, 2015}}{{cite news|first1=Erik|last1=Ortiz|first2=Nick|last2=Bogert|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/jared-fogle-ex-subway-pitchman-pleads-guilty-child-porn-sex-n466256|title=Jared Fogle, Ex-Subway Pitchman, Gets 15 Years in Prison for Child Porn Charges|work=[[NBC News]]|date=November 19, 2015|accessdate=July 13, 2016}} ==Early life== Fogle was born in [[Indianapolis, Indiana]], to Norman and Adrienne Fogle.{{Cite news|first=Cecil|last=Connelly|title=The Subway Guy, Still on a Roll|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/lifestyle/2003/10/12/the-subway-guy-still-on-a-roll/dc3d1c5b-1ddf-4fea-b28d-b1ef503ca27f/|newspaper=[[The Washington Post]]|publisher=Nash Holdings LLC|location=Washington DC|date=October 19, 2003|accessdate=May 30, 2016}} He has a younger brother and sister. He was raised in a Jewish home.{{cite news|first=Justin|last=Moyer|title=Why Jared Fogle was — and still might be — the perfect Subway spokesman|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2015/07/08/why-jared-fogle-was-and-still-might-be-the-perfect-subway-spokesman/|work=[[The Washington Post]]|publisher=Nash Holdings LLC|location=Washington DC|date=July 8, 2015|accessdate=September 2, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Former Subway rep Jared Fogle pleads guilty to pornography charges, sex with minors|url=http://www.jta.org/2015/08/19/news-opinion/united-states/former-subway-rep-jared-fogle-pleads-guilty-to-pornography-charges-sex-with-minors|work=[[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]]|location=New York City|date=August 19, 2015|accessdate=September 2, 2015}} He became a [[Bar and Bat Mitzvah|Bar Mitzvah]] while on a trip to Israel, and then was confirmed by his [[Conservative Judaism|Conservative]]-[[Reconstructionist Judaism|Reconstructionist]] synagogue.{{Cite news|first=Alan|last=Smason|title='Subway guy' helps open kosher Subway@theJ|url=http://www.clevelandjewishnews.com/archives/subway-guy-helps-open-kosher-subway-thej/article_0ebf04b5-d8d7-5caf-a56a-5cfa33b82ebb.html|newspaper=[[Cleveland Jewish News]]|publisher=Cleveland Jewish Publication Co.|location=Cleveland, Ohio|date=June 15, 2006|access-date=November 4, 2010|quote=Fogle, who became a bar mitzvah in Israel on a Federation- and synagogue-sponsored trip there and was confirmed at his Conservative-Reconstructionist synagogue, was impressed with the concept of launching a kosher Subway}} In 1995, Fogle graduated from [[North Central High School (Indianapolis)|North Central High School]] in Indianapolis.{{cite news|first1=Sean|last1=Federico-O'Murchu|first2=Tracy|last2=O'Conner|title=Jared Fogle Out of the Picture After School Yanks Alumni Photo|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/jared-fogle-out-picture-after-school-yanks-alumni-photo-n413211|work=[[NBC News]]|date=August 20, 2015|accessdate=May 30, 2016}} He graduated from [[Indiana University]] in 2000 and then worked briefly in the revenue management department at [[ATA Airlines|American Trans Air]].{{cite news|first=Kim|last=Susana|title=Jared Fogle's Life From Jet Setter to Likely Prison Term|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/jared-fogles-life-jet-setter-prison-term/story?id=33182946|work=[[ABC News]]|date=August 19, 2015|accessdate=August 21, 2015}} ==Subway campaign== Fogle first came to media attention in April 1999, via an article written by a former dorm-mate about Fogle's weight loss and published in the ''[[Indiana Daily Student]]''.{{cite book|first=Chip|last1=Heath|first2=Dan|last2=Heath|title=[[Made to Stick|Made to Stick: Why Some Ideas Survive and Others Die]]|date=December 18, 2006|pages=218–221|publisher=[[Random House]]|location=New York City|ISBN=978-1-4000-6428-1}} Subsequently, Fogle was featured in a ''[[Men's Health]]'' magazine article, "Stupid Diets ... that Work!"{{cite magazine|first=Duane|last=Swierczynski|url=http://connection.ebscohost.com/c/articles/2333652/stupid-diets-that-work|title=Stupid Diets ... That Work!|magazine=[[Men's Health]]|publisher=[[Rodale, Inc.]]|location=Emmaus, Pennsylvania|volume=14|number=9|pages=94–98|date=November 1999|accessdate=March 8, 2018}} According to the article, Fogle had become obese through lack of exercise and eating junk food. Fogle changed his eating habits upon the switch to eating at Subway by eating smaller portions that were free of high-calorie condiments such as mayonnaise. While following this diet, he lost over {{convert|200|lb|kg}}. A [[Chicago]]-area Subway [[Franchising|franchisee]] took Fogle's story to Subway's Chicago-based advertising agency. [[Image:Subway Bloom.JPG|thumb|The [[Bloomington, Indiana|Bloomington]] Subway restaurant that Fogle habitually visited]] As a test, the company ran a regional television advertising campaign. The first ad aired on January 1, 2000, introducing Fogle and his story with the following disclaimer: "The Subway diet, combined with a lot of walking, worked for Jared. We're not saying this is for everyone. You should check with your doctor before starting any diet program. But it worked for Jared."{{cite news|first=Bill|last=Mardis|url=http://somerset-kentucky.com/local/x681549706/-Subway-Guy-Visits-Somerset|title='Subway Guy' Visits Somerset|newspaper=[[Commonwealth Journal]]|publisher=[[Community Newspaper Holdings]]|location=Somerset, Kentucky|date=September 3, 2008|access-date=September 20, 2013}} Because the introductory test-ads were a success, Fogle subsequently appeared in more television commercials as well as sponsored in-store appearances throughout the United States. He gave talks on the benefits of fitness and healthy eating.{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2004/03/02/48hours/main603484.shtml|title=The Subway Diet: Jared Fogle Becomes A Celebrity By Losing Weight|work=[[48 Hours (TV series)|48 Hours]]|network=[[CBS]]|location=New York City|date=September 3, 2004|accessdate=February 18, 2008}} In 2002, Fogle was the subject of an episode of ''[[South Park]]'' titled "[[Jared Has Aides]]".{{cite web|first=Kevin|last=Clemons|title=dOc DVD Review: South Park: The Complete Sixth Season (2002)|url=http://www.digitallyobsessed.com/displaylegacy.php?ID=7957|website=digitallyObsessed|date=October 10, 2005|access-date=September 17, 2013}} Fogle has stated that while the episode had "typical[ly] tasteless humor," the fact that an entire episode was devoted to him was "very flattering." He added, "you know you've made it when shows like ''South Park'' start parodying you."{{cite news|first=Bob|last=Levey|title=Q&A With Bob Levey|work=[[The Washington Post]]|publisher=[[Nash Holdings LLC]]|location=Washington, DC|date=March 18, 2003}} In February 2008, a Subway campaign called "Tour de Pants" celebrated Fogle maintaining his weight loss for a decade. As part of the campaign, Fogle made an announcement that he would retire his pair of {{convert|62|in|cm|adj=on}} pants to a museum at the end of the advertising tour.{{cite magazine|first=Emily|last=Bryson York|url=http://adage.com/article?article_id=125142|title=Subway Can't Stop Jonesing for Jared|magazine=[[Advertising Age]]|publisher=[[Crain Communications]]|location=Detroit, Michigan|date=February 18, 2008|accessdate=February 18, 2008}} Beginning in 2008, Fogle's presence in Subway advertisements decreased due to the company's placing a new emphasis on its "[[Subway $5 footlong promotion|$5 Footlong]]" promotion.{{cite web|first=Matthew|last=Boyle|url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/pf_article_108119.html|title=The Accidental Hero|website=[[Yahoo! Finance]]|publisher=[[Oath Communications Inc.]]|location=New York City|date=November 10, 2009|access-date=July 12, 2017}} Fogle's role in Subway afforded him some other opportunities, such as appearances in [[WWE]] in 2009{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/archive/05042009/mickiejamesvsmaryse |title=Mickie James vs. Divas Champion Maryse |website=[[WWE.com]] |date= |access-date=November 20, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/archive/05042009/mickiejamesvsmaryse/ |title=WWE: TV Shows > Raw > Archive > 05/04/2009 > Mickie James vs. Divas Champion Maryse |website=[[WWE.com]]|date=May 20, 2009 |access-date=July 12, 2017}} and 2011.{{cite web|first=James|last=Wortman|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/2011-08-15/results|title=Raw results: California scheming|website=[[WWE.com]]|date=August 15, 2011|accessdate=September 26, 2011}} By 2013, Fogle had filmed more than 300 commercials and continued to make appearances and speeches for the company. Subway attributed one third to one half of its growth in sales to Fogle, with revenue having tripled from 1998 to 2011.{{cite news|first=Rheana|last=Murray|title=Subway commercial spokesman Jared Fogle marks 15 years of turkey subs and keeping the weight off|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/health/jared-subway-guy-marks-15-years-turkey-subs-article-1.1365511|newspaper=[[New York Daily News]]|publisher=[[Tronc]]|location=New York City|date=June 9, 2013|accessdate=November 18, 2014}} Fogle has also made appearances in the ''[[Sharknado]]'' film series, beginning with ''[[Sharknado 2: The Second One]]''. He also had a cameo appearance in ''[[Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!]]'', though this was cut from the [[Syfy|Syfy Channel]] broadcast version a week before the premiere when his house was searched by the FBI.{{cite news|first=Tierney|last=Bricker|title=Jared Fogle Dropped from Sharknado 3 Amidst Scandal|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/674564/jared-fogle-s-cameo-in-sharknado-3-cut-in-wake-of-scandal|website=[[E! Online]]|publisher=[[E!]]|location=Los Angeles, California|date=July 9, 2015|accessdate=January 31, 2016|quote=Fogle's appearance in the Syfy TV movie was cut in the wake of the FBI raiding his home on Tuesday. Fogle was not arrested or charged with any crimes, [...]}} == Jared Foundation == In 2004, Fogle established the Jared Foundation, a nonprofit organization focused on raising awareness about [[childhood obesity]] through educational programs and tools provided to parents, schools, and community organizations.{{cite news|first=Justin Wm.|last=Moyer|title=Jared Fogle: Another VIP claiming to help children but who allegedly harmed them|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2015/08/20/jared-fogle-another-vip-claiming-to-help-children-who-allegedly-harmed-them/|work=[[The Washington Post]]|publisher=Nash Holdings LLC|location=Washington DC|date=August 20, 2015|accessdate=August 22, 2015}} On April 29, 2015, Russell Taylor, director of the Jared Foundation, was arrested at his Indianapolis home on charges of child exploitation, possession of child pornography, and [[Voyeurism#Criminology|voyeurism]]. Fogle severed all ties with him immediately following the arrest.{{cite news|first1=Greg|last1=Margason|first2=Kendall|last2=Downing|title=Executive director of Jared Foundation arrested on child pornography, exploitation charges|url=http://fox59.com/2015/04/29/executive-director-of-jared-foundation-arrested-on-child-pornography-charges/|work=[[WXIN]]|location=Indianapolis, Indiana|date=April 29, 2015|accessdate=July 7, 2015}} Taylor attempted suicide on May 6, 2015, at the [[Marion County, Indiana|Marion County]] Jail and was placed on life support.{{cite news|first1=Madeline|last1=Buckley|first2=Justin|last2=Mack|title=Police raid home of Subway pitchman Jared Fogle|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2015/07/07/police-investigation-jared-fogle-subway-pitchman/29808241/|newspaper=[[USA Today]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Mclean, Virginia|date=July 7, 2015|accessdate=July 7, 2015}}{{cite news|first=Kyee|last=Wierks|title=Former Jared Foundation Director Russell Taylor attempted to commit suicide at the Marion County Jail|url=http://fox59.com/2015/05/06/former-jared-foundation-director-russell-taylor-attempts-suicide-in-marion-county-jail/|work=[[WXIN]]|location=Indianapolis, Indiana|date=May 6, 2015|accessdate=July 7, 2015}} Taylor pleaded guilty to the charges on September 1, 2015, and on December 10, 2015, was sentenced to 27 years in federal prison. In August 2015, a ''[[USA Today]]'' article{{cite news|first1=Thomas|last1=Frank|first2=Marisa|last2=Kwiatkowski|first3=Tony|last3=Cook|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2015/08/22/jared-subway-charges-children/32155115/|title=From obesity to duplicity: Jared's fall to Earth|newspaper=[[USA Today]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Mclean, Virginia|date=August 23, 2015|accessdate=August 25, 2015}} reported that the Jared Foundation had not issued any grants nor had it given funds for its stated purpose. The article further noted that, on average, the foundation spent $73,000 a year, with the majority of that figure paying the salary of the foundation's executive director. More than one-quarter of the funds were unaccounted for per the foundation's tax records. The [[Secretary of State of Indiana]] dissolved the organization in February 2012 because it did not pay the required five-dollar annual reporting fees during the two previous years, despite being requested to do so on multiple occasions.{{cite web|first=Rick|last=Callahan|title=Future of Subway pitchman's foundation unclear after raid|url=http://www.salon.com/2015/07/09/future_of_subway_pitchmans_foundation_unclear_after_raid/|website=[[Salon.com]]|publisher=[[Salon Media Group]]|location=San Francisco, California|date=July 8, 2015|accessdate=May 16, 2016}} Daniel Borochoff, president of the non-profit charity watchdog group [[CharityWatch]], was quoted by ''USA Today'' as saying, "If Jared was really interested in helping children through his foundation, he could have gotten more money. As with a lot of celebrities, the charity appears to be more about image-enhancement than charitable deeds." == Legal history == === Child pornography investigation and arrest === Fogle first came to the attention of law enforcement in 2007, when reporter Rochelle Herman-Walrond told police in [[Sarasota, Florida]], that he had made salacious comments to her about [[middle school]]-aged girls at a school health event she was covering for a local news station. She made recordings of Fogle's remarks and saved text messages between them, and then went to the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]] (FBI), where agents asked her to wear a wiretap during her conversations with him. Herman-Walrond befriended Fogle and, for the next four years, surreptitiously recorded her conversations with him as part of an ongoing federal investigation.{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/woman-helped-subway-spokesman-jared-fogle/story?id=33197355 |work=ABC News|title=The Woman Who Said She Helped Take Down Ex-Subway Spokesman Jared Fogle|last=Perez|first=Alex|date=August 20, 2015|access-date=May 15, 2016}} She recorded him making several remarks about having had sex with underage girls and asking her to install a [[webcam]] in her children's rooms so he could watch them.{{cite web |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/fbi-informant-shares-lurid-details-of-jared-fogle-secret-recordings/|title=FBI informant shares lurid details of Jared Fogle secret recordings|website=[[CBS]]|publisher=[[CBS Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=October 29, 2015|access-date=May 16, 2016}} Ultimately, however, the FBI could not pursue a case against Fogle using the recordings, because they needed more substantive evidence against him.{{cite web |first=Max|last=Winitz|url=http://www.mysuncoast.com/news/local/why-did-the-jared-fogle-investigation-take-so-long/article_70e4e29e-4840-11e5-9e56-4bc894c2f0d2.html|work=MySuncoast|title=Why did the Jared Fogle investigation take so long?|date=August 21, 2015|access-date=July 13, 2016}} During the investigation into Russell Taylor's child pornography operation, authorities discovered that Taylor had traded sexually explicit photos and videos of children, some as young as six, with Fogle. Taylor, who was sentenced to 27 years in prison,{{cite web |first=Hilary|last=Shenfield|url=http://www.people.com/article/jared-fogle-associate-russell-taylor-sentenced-27-years|title=Jared Fogle Associate Russell Taylor Sentenced to 27 Years in Child Porn Case|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=December 10, 2015|accessdate=May 14, 2016}} was later named an [[unindicted co-conspirator]] in the FBI's case against Fogle.{{cite web |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/united-states-attorney-jared-fogle-used-wealth-status-and-secrecy-to-exploit-kids/ |title=U.S. Atty: Jared Fogle used "wealth, status and secrecy" to exploit kids|website=[[CBS News]]|publisher=[[CBS Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=August 19, 2015|accessdate=November 19, 2015}} "What we found in Russell Taylor's home and on his computers led us to Jared Fogle," said Tim Horty, a spokesman for the [[United States Department of Justice]]. On July 7, 2015, the FBI and [[Indiana State Police]] investigators raided Fogle's [[Zionsville, Indiana]], residence; computers and other electronic equipment were removed from his home.{{cite news|first1=Matt|last1=Adams|first2=Zach|last2=Myers|title=Federal authorities raid home of Subway spokesman Jared Fogle in child pornography investigation|url=http://fox59.com/2015/07/07/federal-authorities-raid-home-of-subway-spokesman-jared-fogle/|work=[[WXIN]]|location=Indianapolis, Indiana|date=July 7, 2015|accessdate=March 8, 2018}}{{cite news|first1=Jason|last1=Hanna|first2=Chuck|last2=Johnston|title=Authorities search Subway pitchman Jared Fogle's home|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/07/07/us/indiana-subway-fogle/|publisher=[[CNN]]|location=Atlanta, Georgia|date=July 7, 2015|accessdate=March 8, 2018}} The same day, a spokesperson for Subway announced that the company and Fogle had mutually agreed to suspend their business relationship.{{cite news |first1=Sarah|last1=Larimer |first2=Abby|last2=Ohlheiser |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2015/07/07/reports-investigators-spotted-at-home-of-subway-spokesman-jared-fogle/ |title=Subway, spokesman Jared Fogle 'suspend their relationship' amid investigation |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |publisher=Nash Holdings LLC|location=Washington, DC|date=July 7, 2015 |accessdate=May 14, 2016 }} Subsequently, Subway removed all references to Fogle from its website.{{cite news|first1=Tom|last1=Murphy |first2=Rick|last2=Callahan|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/us/articles/2015/07/07/federal-indiana-authorities-raid-home-of-subway-spokesman |title=Subway suspends ties with spokesman Fogle after raid at home |newspaper=[[U.S. News & World Report]]|publisher=U.S. News & World Report, L.P.|location=Washington DC|date=July 7, 2015 |accessdate=July 12, 2017}} Following Fogle's arrest, the FBI also [[subpoena]]ed a series of [[Text messaging|text messages]] made in 2008 between Fogle and Subway franchisee Cindy Mills, with whom he was having a sexual relationship at the time; in these messages, Fogle talked about sexually abusing children ranging in age from nine to 16, told her to sell herself for sex on [[Craigslist]] and asked her to arrange for him to have sex with her 16-year-old cousin.{{cite news |first=Kaja|last=Whitehouse|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2015/08/28/subway-executives-knew-jared-fogel-pedophile-children-former-franchisee/71297640/|title=Franchisee: Subway execs knew about Jared Fogle's interest in children|newspaper=[[USA Today]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=McLean, Virginia|date=August 28, 2015|accessdate=December 30, 2017}}{{cite web|first=Kate|last=Briquelet|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/jared-fogles-ex-wife-says-subway-knew-its-spokesman-was-a-pedophile |title=Jared Fogle's Ex-Wife Says Subway Knew Its Spokesman Was a Pedophile|website=[[The Daily Beast]] |publisher=[[IAC (company)|IAC]]|location=New York City|date=October 24, 2016 |accessdate=December 30, 2017}} Mills' lawyer said that she had alerted Subway's corporate management about the text messages, but that they had responded that because Fogle was not a Subway employee, there was no violation. Subway representatives said they had no record of Mills's allegations.{{cite magazine |first=Hayley|last=Peterson|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/fbi-subpoenae-subway-jared-fogles-text-2015-7|title=The FBI has subpoenaed lewd text messages between Subway's Jared Fogle and a former Subway franchisee|magazine=[[Business Insider]]|publisher=[[Axel Springer SE]]|location=New York City|date=July 31, 2015|accessdate=November 19, 2015}} === Plea agreement === On August 19, 2015, federal prosecutors announced they had reached a deal with Fogle in which he would plead guilty to two counts, one of distribution and receipt of child pornography and one of traveling to engage in illicit sexual conduct with a minor—specifically, from [[Indiana]] to [[New York City]], where he is charged with paying to engage in sexual acts with a 17-year-old girl.{{cite web |url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/ct-pdf-federal-lawsuit-filed-against-jared-fogle-20150819-htmlstory.html |title=PDF: United States of America v. Jared Fogle |date=August 19, 2015}} Prosecutors alleged that Fogle offered adult prostitutes a [[finder's fee]] to find him younger sex partners. According to documents released by federal prosecutors, Fogle has also agreed to pay a total of $1.4 million in restitution—$100,000 to each victim.{{cite news|first1=Jackie|last1=Willis|title=Jared Fogle's Wife Filing for Divorce After Child Pornography Charges|url=http://www.etonline.com/news/170258_jared_fogle_wife_to_divorce_him_after_child_pornography_charges/|work=[[Entertainment Tonight]]|date=August 19, 2015|access-date=August 19, 2015}} Fogle faced up to 50 years in prison had he gone to trial; however, as part of the plea deal—which was not binding on the sentencing judge—prosecutors agreed to seek no more than 12{{sfrac|1|2}} years. In return, Fogle agreed to a minimum sentence of five years.{{cite news|title=Jared Fogle Charges: The Latest|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/business/articles/2015/08/19/feds-fogle-sought-sex-with-minors-had-child-pornography|agency=[[Associated Press]]|newspaper=[[U.S. News & World Report]]|publisher=U.S. News & World Report, L.P.|location=Washington, DC|date=August 19, 2015|accessdate=August 21, 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/ex-subway-pitchman-to-plead-guilty-to-child-porn-charges-report/ar-CC19mJ|title=Ex-Subway pitchman to plead guilty to child porn charges: report|agency=[[Reuters]]/[[MSN]]|date=August 18, 2015|access-date=February 8, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304061715/http://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/ex-subway-pitchman-to-plead-guilty-to-child-porn-charges-report/ar-CC19mJ|archive-date=March 4, 2016|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}{{cite news|first1=Erik|last1=Ortiz|title=Jared Fogle, Ex-Subway Spokesman, to Plead Guilty to Child Porn Charges: Feds|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/jared-fogle-ex-subway-spokesman-plead-guilty-child-porn-charges-n412316|website=[[NBC News]]|publisher=[[NBCUniversal]]|location=New York City|date=August 19, 2015}} Soon after the plea deal was announced, Subway announced via [[Twitter]] that it had completely severed ties with Fogle.{{cite web|first1=Andy|last1=Campbell|first2=Michael|last2=McLaughlin|title=Subway Fires Jared Fogle Ahead Of Expected Child Porn Guilty Plea|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/subway-fires-jared-fogle-ahead-of-expected-child-porn-guilty-plea_55d3b609e4b07addcb448ac3|website=[[HuffPost|The Huffington Post]]|publisher=[[Huffington Post Media Group]]|location=New York City|date=August 19, 2015|accessdate=August 19, 2015}} As a condition of his plea deal, Fogle would be restricted to supervised contact or communication with minors upon approval of his probation officer. Supervised visits with his own children would be allowed only with approval of their mother.{{cite magazine|first=Char|last=Adams|title=Jared Fogle's Wife Seeks Divorce as Subway Spokesman Faces up to 12½ Years in Prison for Child Sex Charges|url=http://www.people.com/article/jared-fogle-wife-divorce-child-porn-charges|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=August 19, 2015|accessdate=August 19, 2015}} Fogle had already made a request to visit his two children in September, but McLaughlin contested it. Upon release from prison, Fogle will be required to [[Sex offender registry|register]] as a [[sex offender]] for the remainder of his life and undergo treatment for [[Sexual dysfunction|sexual disorders]].{{cite news|title=U.S. attorney: Jared Fogle used 'wealth, status and secrecy' to exploit children|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/ct-jared-fogle-subway-child-porn-20150819-story.html|newspaper=[[Chicago Tribune]]|publisher=[[Tronc]]|location=Chicago, Illinois|date=August 19, 2015|accessdate=August 19, 2015}} On November 19, 2015, Fogle formally pleaded guilty before federal judge [[Tanya Walton Pratt]]. In a statement, Fogle apologized for his crimes, saying that he wanted a chance to become a "good, honest person" and "redeem [his] life" after being ensnared in a life of "deception, lies and complete self-centeredness." According to Dr. John Bradford, a [[forensic psychiatry|forensic psychiatrist]] who testified for Fogle's defense team, Fogle suffered from a compulsive [[eating disorder]] for several years before losing weight, and replaced food with a sense of "[[hypersexuality]]," which included "mild" or "weak" [[pedophilia]]. That diagnosis was not accepted by experts in the psychiatry field and was criticized by Pratt and on [[social media]].{{cite news|first=Jeremy|last=Berke|title=Ex-Subway pitchman Jared Fogle's 'diagnosis' doesn't show up in the bible of psychiatric disorders|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/jared-fogle-was-diagnosed-as-a-weak-pedophile-2015-11|magazine=[[Business Insider]]|publisher=[[Axel Springer SE]]|location=New York City|date=August 19, 2015|accessdate=August 14, 2016}}{{cite news|first=Vic|last=Ryckaert|title=Jared Fogle's 'mild pedophilia' diagnosis draws backlash|url=http://www.indystar.com/story/news/crime/2015/11/20/jared-fogles-mild-pedophilia-diagnosis-draws-backlash/76107846/|newspaper=[[The Indianapolis Star]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Indianapolis, Indiana|date=November 21, 2015|accessdate=August 14, 2016}} Liberty Behavioral Health Corp. psychologist Adam Deming suggested that Bradford had meant to say that Fogle's primary sexual attraction was to early teenagers, but that he had a lesser attraction to younger children. Pratt sentenced him to 15 years, 8 months in prison, more than three years more than what prosecutors had sought, and three times what Fogle had requested. "The level of perversion and lawlessness exhibited by Mr. Fogle is extreme," Pratt said. Fogle must serve a minimum of 13 years before becoming eligible for time off with good behavior. After serving his sentence, he will be on [[United States federal probation and supervised release|supervised release]] for the rest of his life.{{cite web|first=Sarah|last=Larimer |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2015/11/19/jared-fogle-ex-subway-spokesman-pleads-guilty-to-child-porn-sex-crimes-against-minors/ |title=Jared Fogle, ex-Subway spokesman, gets 15 years in prison for child porn, sex crimes |work=[[The Washington Post]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Washington, DC|date=November 19, 2015 |accessdate=November 20, 2015}} Pratt also fined him $175,000 and ordered him to forfeit $50,000 in assets (a total of $225,000), in addition to the $1.4 million restitution.[http://www.justice.gov/usao-sdin/pr/jared-s-fogle-sentenced-child-pornography-case Press release] announcing Fogle's sentencing from U.S. Attorney for Southern District of Indiana Fogle's lawyer, Ron Elberger, filed a notice of appeal on December 14, 2015.{{cite web|first=Rafael|last=Sanchez|url=http://www.theindychannel.com/news/u-s-world/jared-fogle-moved-to-federal-oklahoma-city-prison|title=Jared Fogle files appeal, moved to federal Oklahoma City prison|work=The Indy Channel|date=December 15, 2015|accessdate=December 17, 2015}} Fogle is able to appeal the sentence since it is longer than the maximum sentence recommended by the prosecutors. The appeal brief was due by January 25, 2016,{{cite web|first=Rick|last=Callahan|url=http://bigstory.ap.org/ecfe5b80caae474b9a91c581559aecb8|title=Ex-Subway pitchman Jared Fogle appealing child porn sentence|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=December 15, 2015|accessdate=December 17, 2015}} but Fogle asked for an extension for his appeal after Elberger was diagnosed with cancer. The extension was granted.{{cite web|first=Matt|last=Adams|url=http://www.indystar.com/story/news/fox59/2016/01/14/jared-fogle-gets-appeal-extension-after-attorneys-cancer-diagnosis/78801632/|title=Jared Fogle gets appeal extension after attorney's cancer diagnosis|work=[[The Indianapolis Star]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Indianapolis, Indiana|date=January 14, 2016|accessdate=January 17, 2016}} After the appeal was filed, the U.S. Attorney's office responded by opposing any sentence reduction. The office cited Fogle's text messages to a woman, in which Fogle stated he would "pay big" if she could procure 14-year-old children, and that he "craved" underage Asian girls.{{cite news|first=Dan|last=Margason|title=Court docs: Prosecutors push back against Jared Fogel's (sic) appeal|url=http://cbs4indy.com/2016/04/18/court-docs-prosecutors-push-back-against-jared-fogle-appeal/|work=cbs4indy.com|date=April 27, 2015|accessdate=April 27, 2016}}{{cite news|first=Martha|last=Ross|title=Jared Fogel (sic) pens icky, flirty letter to woman from prison|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/celebrities/ci_29766658/jared-fogle-pens-icky-flirty-letter-woman-from.html/|work=[[Mercury News]]|publisher=[[Digital First Media]]|location=Denver, Colorado|date=April 14, 2015|accessdate=July 13, 2016}}{{cite news|author=TMZ Staff|title=Jared Fogle Prosecutors Say Shocking Sex Texts Justify Sentence|url=http://www.tmz.com/2016/04/18/jared-fogle-sex-texts-child-molestation-sentence?adid=TMZ_Search_Results|work=www.tmz.com|date=April 18, 2016|access-date=July 13, 2016}}{{cite news|first=Joe|last=Tacopino|title=Jared Fogle 'craved' 14-year-old Asian girls: text messages|url=https://nypost.com/2016/04/19/jared-fogle-craved-14-year-old-asian-girls-text-messages/ |newspaper=[[New York Post]]|publisher=[[News Corp.]]|location=New York City|date=April 14, 2015|accessdate=April 27, 2016}} In these text messages, he also expressed sexual interest in young boys, although there is to date no evidence that he paid for sex with male children.{{cite news|title=Docs: Jared Fogle texts show pursuit of young victims|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/documents-jared-fogle-texts-show-pursuit-of-young-victims/ |website=[[CBS News]]|publisher=[[CBS Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=April 19, 2016|accessdate=July 21, 2016}} On June 9, 2016, Fogle's sentence was upheld by a federal appeals court.{{cite news|first=Kristine|last=Guerra|url=http://www.indystar.com/story/news/crime/2016/06/09/jared-fogles-sentence-upheld-federal-appeals-court/85668290/ |title=Jared Fogle's sentence upheld by federal appeals court |newspaper=[[The Indianapolis Star]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Indianapolis, Indiana|date=June 9, 2016|accessdate=June 27, 2016}} === Incarceration === [[File:Fcienglewood.jpg|thumb|[[Federal Correctional Institution, Englewood]], where Fogle is incarcerated]] Fogle's lawyers recommended that he serve his sentence at [[Federal Correctional Institution, Englewood]] near [[Littleton, Colorado]]; it has a program for sex offenders. Pratt agreed with the recommendations, but she had no authority to determine where Fogle would serve his sentence.{{cite news|first=Mark|last=Alesia |url=http://www.indystar.com/story/news/crime/2015/11/18/jared-fogle-subway-prison-child-pornography-russell-taylor/75934522/ |title=Jared Fogle sentenced to 15 years, eight months in prison |work=[[The Indianapolis Star]] |publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Indianapolis, Indiana|date=November 19, 2015 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6dMTWodYz?url=http://www.indystar.com/story/news/crime/2015/11/18/jared-fogle-subway-prison-child-pornography-russell-taylor/75934522/ |archivedate=November 27, 2015 |df= }} () On November 21, 2015, Fogle arrived at the [[Henderson County, Kentucky]] Detention Center, where he was held on a temporary basis.{{cite web|first=Jessica|last=Gavin|url=http://www.14news.com/story/30564132/jared-fogle-heading-to-henderson-co-detention-center|title=Jared Fogle arrives at Henderson Co. Detention Center|network=[[WFIE]] (14 News)|date=November 20, 2015|accessdate=November 28, 2015}} Fogle entered [[Federal Bureau of Prisons]] (BOP) custody, going to [[Federal Transfer Center, Oklahoma City]], on December 15, 2015. On December 18, Fogle was transferred to FCI Englewood.{{cite web|first=Deb|last=Stanley|url=http://www.thedenverchannel.com/news/front-range/englewood/former-subway-pitchman-jared-fogle-moved-to-colorado-prison-englewood-fci|title=Former Subway pitchman Jared Fogle moved to Colorado prison - Englewood FCI|work=The Denver Channel|network=ABC Denver|date=December 18, 2015|accessdate=December 24, 2015}} Fogle's BOP number is 12919-028. His earliest possible release date is July 11, 2029, a month before his 52nd birthday."[http://www.bop.gov/inmateloc/ Inmate Locator]." [[Federal Bureau of Prisons]]. Retrieved on December 6, 2015. He is listed as "Jared S Fogle" In March 2016, Fogle was assaulted by another inmate, Steven Nigg, reportedly because Nigg hates child molesters. The attack left Fogle with a bleeding nose, swollen face and scratches on his neck.{{cite web|author=TMZ Staff|url=http://www.tmz.com/2016/03/16/jared-fogle-prison-fight-beating/ |title=Jared Fogle: Beaten and Bloodied in Prison Yard Ambush |website=[[TMZ]] |date=March 16, 2016 |access-date=June 27, 2016}}{{cite news|first=Justin Wm.|last=Moyer|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2016/03/17/had-to-hit-him-jared-fogle-imprisoned-ex-subway-guy-reportedly-beaten-by-inmate-who-hates-child-molesters/|title='Had to hit him': Jared Fogle, imprisoned ex-Subway guy, reportedly beaten by inmate who hates 'child molesters'|work=[[The Washington Post]]|publisher=Nash Holdings, LLC.|location=Washington, DC|date=March 17, 2016|accessdate=March 8, 2018}}{{cite web|first=Amy|last=Graff|url=http://www.sfgate.com/news/article/Jared-Fogle-prison-attack-Subway-Steven-Nigg-6895810.php |title=Steven Nigg's nephew: Jared Fogle is 'lucky he's still alive' after prison attack |newspaper=[[San Francisco Chronicle]] |publisher=[[Hearst Corporation]]|location=San Francisco, California|date=March 17, 2016 |access-date=June 12, 2016}} Nigg was then transferred to the [[Federal Transfer Center, Oklahoma City|Federal Transfer Center]] in [[Oklahoma City, Oklahoma]], before being transferred to [[Federal Correctional Institution, Safford|FCI Safford]] in [[Safford, Arizona]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bop.gov/inmateloc/|title=Inmate Locator|website=www.bop.gov|access-date=May 10, 2017}} On November 8, 2017, Pratt dismissed a motion filed by Fogle hoping to overturn his convictions by stating that the federal court did not have jurisdiction to convict him.{{cite news|first=Tim|last=Evans|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/business/2017/11/13/judge-boots-ex-subway-spokesman-jared-fogles-child-sex-case-appeal/860830001/|title=Judge boots ex-Subway spokesman Jared Fogle's child sex case appeal|newspaper=[[USA Today]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Mclean, Virginia|date=November 13, 2017|access-date=November 14, 2017}} She also dismissed another motion filed on behalf of Fogle by fellow inmate Frank Pate stating the court did not have jurisdiction because of Fogle's status as a purported "[[Sovereign citizen movement|sovereign citizen]]."{{cite news|first=Mike|last=Reynolds|url=https://www.courthousenews.com/disgraced-pitchman-loses-bid-toss-sex-crimes-sentence/|title=Disgraced Pitchman Loses Bid to Toss Sex-Crimes Sentence|newspaper=Court House News|publisher=[[Courthouse News Service]]|location=Pasadena, California|date=November 9, 2017|access-date=November 14, 2017}} ===Civil lawsuits=== The parents of one of Fogle's victims filed a civil [[lawsuit]] against Fogle for [[personal injury]] and emotional distress.{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/ex-subway-pitchman-jared-fogle-makes-surprise-move/|title=Ex-Subway pitchman Jared Fogle makes surprise move|agency=[[Associated Press]]|website=[[CBS News]]|publisher=[[CBS Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=September 2, 2016|accessdate=October 9, 2018}} Fogle filed a [[Motion (legal)|motion]] arguing that the parents are actually [[Legal liability|liable]] for the injuries because the parents fought and abused alcohol in front of the daughter. On October 24, 2016, Kathleen McLaughlin's lawyers filed suit against Subway in Indiana.{{cite web|url=https://www.scribd.com/document/328745491/Fogle-Ex-Wife-Lawsuit |title=Fogle Ex Wife Lawsuit |last=Cleary|first=Tom|publisher=scribd.com |date=October 24, 2016 |access-date=June 22, 2017}}{{cite web|first=Tom|last=Cleary|url=http://heavy.com/news/2016/10/kathleen-katie-mclaughlin-jared-fogle-ex-wife-lawsuit-sues-subway-document-knew-sexual-abuse-child/ |title=Jared Fogle's Ex-Wife Katie McLaughlin Sues Subway [DOCUMENT] |website=[[Heavy.com]] |publisher=Heavy Inc.|location=New York City|date=October 24, 2016 |access-date=June 22, 2017}} The suit alleges that Subway violated McLaughlin's privacy and property rights, and caused personal injury to McLaughlin by covering up at least three instances of Fogle's illegal behavior that were reported to senior management, including the allegation that Subway's senior vice president of marketing hushed up a 2004 incident in which Fogle propositioned a young girl at a promotional event at a Subway franchise in Las Vegas. The lawsuit was dismissed in October 2017, with the judge writing that the court lacked jurisdiction, since their principal business operations were outside Indiana.{{cite news|url=https://www.seattletimes.com/business/judge-tosses-lawsuit-by-jared-fogles-ex-wife-against-subway/|title=Judge tosses lawsuit by Jared Fogle's ex-wife against Subway|newspaper=[[Seattle Times]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[The Seattle Times Company]]|location=Seattle, Washington|date=October 4, 2017 |access-date=October 9, 2018}} ===Potential for other criminal charges=== [[New York (state)|State of New York]] authorities could charge Fogle with committing state crimes related to Victims 13 and 14; since it would be the state government rather than the federal government, doing so would not violate [[double jeopardy]]. Potential state crimes would include statutory rape and/or trafficking persons for sexual reasons. New York defense attorney and former assistant district attorney Matthew R. Smalls stated that New York State is unlikely to bring state charges since it would have to make a new investigation and get testimony from victims. Abby Phillip of the ''[[Washington Post]]'' stated "As a legal matter, Fogle may never be charged with rape — or legally labeled with having committed that crime."{{cite web|first=Abby|last=Phillip|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2015/08/25/jared-fogle-admitted-to-sex-crimes-against-minors-why-wasnt-he-charged-with-rape/|title=Jared Fogle admitted to sex crimes against minors. Why wasn't he charged with rape?|newspaper=[[The Washington Post]]|publisher=Nash Holdings LLC|location=Washington DC|date=August 25, 2015|access-date=October 23, 2016}} == Personal life == Fogle married Elizabeth Christie, a pediatric nurse, on October 14, 2001; the couple divorced on October 18, 2007. In November 2009, Fogle became engaged to Kathleen "Katie" McLaughlin, a teacher.{{cite magazine|first=Michelle|last=Tan|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20335717,00.html|title=Jared the Subway Guy Is Engaged!|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=January 8, 2010|access-date=August 29, 2010}}{{cite web|first=Tim|last=Stelloh|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/jared-fogle-s-ex-wife-kathleen-mclaughlin-sues-subway-restaurant-n672046|title=Jared Fogle's Ex-Wife, Kathleen McLaughlin, Sues Subway Restaurant Chain|website=[[NBC News]]|publisher=[[NBCUniversal]]|location=New York City|date=October 24, 2016|access-date=November 10, 2016}} In January 2010, ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' reported that Fogle had gained back {{convert|40|lb|kg}} and planned to lose it by way of his Subway weight-loss program for his upcoming wedding.{{cite magazine|first=Michelle|last=Tan|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20335543,00.html|title=Jared the Subway Guy His New Weight Struggle |magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=January 18, 2010|access-date=August 29, 2010}} Fogle and McLaughlin married in August 2010 and had two children together: a son, Brady (born 2011), and a daughter, Quinn (born 2013).{{cite news|first1=Hilary|last1=Shenfeld|title=Former Subway Spokesman Jared Fogle Hasn't Been Seen Since Raid on Home, Neighbors Say|url=http://www.people.com/article/jared-fogle-not-seen-since-raid|access-date=August 19, 2015|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=August 19, 2015}}{{cite news|first1=Jennifer|last1=Chaussee|title=Subway planned to rebrand Jared Fogle as a family man before FBI raid|url=http://www.seattletimes.com/nation-world/subway-planned-to-rebrand-jared-fogleas-a-family-man-before-fbi-raid/|newspaper=[[The Seattle Times]]|publisher=[[The Seattle Times Company]]|location=Seattle, Washington|date=July 9, 2015|access-date=August 19, 2015}} In 2013 Fogle had a net worth of $15 million.{{r|murray20130609}} On August 19, 2015, following Fogle's appearance in federal court on charges of sex with minors and child pornography, his wife released a statement through her attorney announcing that she was seeking a divorce. She added that she was focused "exclusively on the well-being of my children" and would have no further comment.{{cite magazine|first=Sierra|last=Marquina|url=https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jared-fogles-ex-wife-when-i-learned-of-his-pedophilia-w448738/|title=Jared Fogle's Ex-Wife Katie McLaughlin Had No Idea He Was A Pedophile: "He Had Two Lives Going On"|magazine=[[US Weekly]]|publisher=[[American Media Inc.]]|location=New York City|date=November 4, 2016|accessdate=March 21, 2018}}{{cite news|first=Tara|last=Fowler|url=http://www.people.com/article/jared-fogles-wife-katie-officially-files-for-divorce|title=Jared Fogle's Wife Officially Files for Divorce, Citing 'Irretrievable Breakdown of the Marriage'|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=August 20, 2015|access-date=September 2, 2015}} Their divorce was finalized on November 16, 2015; Fogle agreed to pay his now ex-wife $7 million. According to court filings, she had traveled out of state before Fogle's guilty plea, and opted to stay in an undisclosed location to protect herself and the children from the "media circus" surrounding Fogle's crimes.{{cite news|title=Judge finalizes Jared Fogle's divorce|url=http://www.indystar.com/story/news/crime/2015/11/25/details-jared-fogles-divorce-petition/76365162/|newspaper=[[The Indianapolis Star]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Indianapolis, Indiana|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=November 25, 2015|accessdate=November 26, 2015}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable" | Notes |- | 2000–2015 | Subway commercials | Himself | |- | 2002, 2008 | ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' | Himself | "Kirsten Dunst/Eminem", "Michael Phelps/Lil' Wayne" |- | 2004 | ''[[Super Size Me]]'' | Himself | |- | 2011 |''[[Jack and Jill (2011 film)|Jack and Jill]]'' | Jared Fogle | |- | 2014 | ''[[Sharknado 2: The Second One]]'' | Jared from Subway | |- | 2015 | ''[[Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!]]'' | Jared Fogle | Credited as Jared S. Fogle; cut from SyFy Channel broadcast version |- | 2015 | ''[[Dr. Phil (talk show)|Dr. Phil]]'' | Himself | "Subway Sandwich King to Child Sex Scandal: Jared Fogel's (sic) Secret Audio Tapes" |- |} ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== {{Wikiquote}} {{Commons category}} * {{IMDb name|1815678}} * [http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/08/19/fogle.indictment.pdf Indictment, United States v. Jared Fogle] ([https://www.webcitation.org/6auI7k9CO?url=http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/08/19/fogle.indictment.pdf Archive]) * [http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/08/19/fogle.plea.pdf Plea Agreement] ([https://www.webcitation.org/6auIBRkLx?url=http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/08/19/fogle.plea.pdf Archive]) * Archived official pages from Subway: "[https://web.archive.org/web/20080701193816/http://www.subwayfreshbuzz.com:80/jareds_tenth/ Jared's Tenth]" and "[https://web.archive.org/*/http://www.subway.com:80/subwayroot/menunutrition/jared/index.aspx All About Jared]" {{Subway restaurant}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fogle, Jared}} [[Category:1977 births]] [[Category:21st-century American criminals]] [[Category:21st-century American male actors]] [[Category:Advertising and marketing controversies]] [[Category:American Jews]] [[Category:American male criminals]] [[Category:American criminals]] [[Category:American male film actors]] [[Category:American people convicted of child pornography offenses]] [[Category:American people convicted of child sexual abuse]] [[Category:American prisoners and detainees]] [[Category:American sex offenders]] [[Category:American television personalities]] [[Category:Corporate mascots]] [[Category:Criminals from Indiana]] [[Category:Indiana University Bloomington alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Male actors from Indianapolis]] [[Category:People from Zionsville, Indiana]] [[Category:Prisoners and detainees of the United States federal government]] [[Category:Subway (restaurant)]] [[Category:Spokespersons]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox musical artist | name = John Cort | image = John Cort 1910.jpeg | image_size = | landscape = <!-- yes, if wide image, otherwise leave blank --> | alt = | caption = | background = non_performing_personnel | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = ca. 1861 | birth_place = [[New York City]], United States | origin = | death_date = {{death year and age|1929|1861|11}} | death_place = | genre = | occupation = [[Impresario]] | instrument = | years_active = <!-- YYYY–YYYY (or –present) --> | label = | associated_acts = | website = <!-- {{URL|example.com}} --> }} '''John Cort''' (ca. 1861<ref>Flom says 1861; IBDB says ca. 1859</ref> – November 17, 1929<ref>{{IBDB name|name=John Cort|id=22590}}. Accessed December 22, 2007.</ref>) was an [[United States|American]] [[impresario]]; his '''Cort Circuit''' was one of the first national theater circuits. Along with [[John Considine (Seattle)|John Considine]] and [[Alexander Pantages]], Cort was one of the [[Seattle, Washington|Seattle]]-based entrepreneurs who parlayed their success in the years following the [[Klondike Gold Rush]] into an impact on America's national theater scene. While Considine and Pantages focused mainly on [[vaudeville]], Cort focused on legitimate theater. At one time, he owned more legitimate theaters than anyone else in the United States, and he eventually became part of the New York theatrical establishment. As of 2016, his [[Cort Theatre]] remains a fixture of [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]].<ref name=Flom>Eric L. Flom, [http://www.historylink.org/essays/output.cfm?file_id=3296 Cort, John (1861–1929)], HistoryLink, August 9, 2001. Accessed December 22, 2007.</ref>
==Variety theater years== The [[New York City]]-born Cort started his career as a stage actor of little distinction<ref name=Flom /> and as part of a comedy duo, Cort and Murphy.<ref name=Reeds>[http://www.reedstickets.net/cort-theater-tickets.html Cort Theater Tickets], Reeds Tickets. Accessed December 22, 2007.</ref> He first became a theater manager in [[Cairo, Illinois|Cairo]], [[Illinois]], then headed west to take over the Standard Theater, a Seattle [[box house]] (a cross between a variety theater, a saloon, and—often—a brothel), which he turned into the city's leading such establishment. A pioneer of theater circuits—booking the same act successively into multiple cities to make it worth their while to tour to his remote part of the country—he was so successful that in 1888 he built a new 800-seat Standard Theater at the southeast corner of Occidental and Washington streets. This was Seattle's first theater with electric lighting, more modern than the gas-lit [[Frye's Opera House]], the city's leading legitimate theater at the time.<ref name=Flom />
The [[Great Seattle Fire]] (June 6, 1889) burned this new Standard and nearly all of Seattle's other places of entertainment. Cort reopened two weeks later in a tent, and by November he had erected a replacement for the Standard.<ref name=Flom />
==Going legitimate== Like John Considine, Cort left Seattle during the depression (and anti-vice reaction) that followed the [[Panic of 1893]], but returned after the [[Klondike Gold Rush]] to build the [[Grand Opera House (Seattle)|Grand Opera House]] (opened 1900) on Cherry Street. Geographically he had crossed north of "[[Pioneer Square, Seattle, Washington|the Deadline]]", Yesler Way, out of the vice-ridden "restricted zone". Artistically, he had crossed from [[variety entertainment]] into legitimate theater.<ref name=Flom />
With Considine, he played a major role in one of the country's rising [[fraternal organization]]s: just before the turn of the century they founded what became the [[Fraternal Order of Eagles]] (F.O.E.). A third founder, [[H. L. Leavitt]], soon bolted to found the [[Loyal Order of Moose]].<ref>[[Murray Morgan]], ''Skid Road'', Ballantine Books (1960), p. 144–146.</ref>
[[File:Moore Theatre 1900 program cover graphics.jpg|thumb|Graphics for a program from Cort's [[Moore Theatre (Seattle, Washington)|Moore Theatre]], Seattle, circa 1907]] By 1903, Cort's Northwestern Theatrical Association<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/1910/11/03/archives/syndicate-denies-a-truce-but-opinion-is-that-a-sort-of-agreement.html Syndicate Denies a Truce; But Opinion Is That a Sort of Agreement Has Been Made with Cort], ''The New York Times'', November 3, 1910, p. 9. Accessed online December 22, 2007.</ref> controlled 37 theaters in the American West, allowing him to compete with some success against the Eastern entertainment establishment. He signed an agreement with [[Marcus Klaw]] and [[Abraham Erlanger]], then the country's leading [[booking agent]]s of dramatic talent, and his theaters became part of the [[Klaw and Erlanger Circuit]]. At this point, he was Seattle's leading theatrical impresario. However, Klaw and Erlanger were more focused on box-office potential than artistic merit, and Cort's position in the market had given him an audience with some critical faculties. If people were being offered badly produced plays, they would skip legitimate theater entirely and go see a vaudeville.<ref name=Flom />
In 1910, Cort helped organize the Independent National Theatre Owner's Association, a group of circuits that tried to break away from the New York-based syndicates. Allied with the independent [[The Shubert Organization|Shubert Organization]], these added up to 1200 theaters nationally.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/1910/05/08/archives/1200-theatres-are-independent-now-managers-of-south-west-and.html 1,200 Theatres Are Independent Now], ''The New York Times'', May 8, 1910, p. 13. Accessed online December 22, 2007.</ref> They eventually forced Klaw and Erlanger to allow theaters to book both Klaw/Erlanger productions and others. Still, while the fight was on, Klaw and Erlanger had backed construction of Seattle's new [[Metropolitan Theatre]] in the prestigious [[Metropolitan Tract (Seattle)|Metropolitan Tract]]. Cort, in turn, headed for New York, where he became a notable producer and manager, as well as the founder of New York's Cort Theatre.<ref name=Flom />
In the summers of 1916-1918, Ruby Stevens (the future [[Barbara Stanwyck]]), travelled with the show, watching her elder sister Mildred perform.<ref>{{Cite book | last = Diorio | first = Al | title = Barbara Stanwyck: a Biography | publisher = Coward-McCann | year = 1983 | location = New York | pages = 249 | isbn = 0-698-11247-4}}</ref>
==Seattle remnants== Cort's Grand Opera House suffered several fires; one of these, in 1917, gutted it, and the building has been a parking garage since 1923. The [[Moore Theatre (Seattle, Washington)|Moore Theatre]], Cort's last Seattle flagship,<ref>[http://www.nps.gov/archive/klse/hrs/hrs6a6.htm Moore Theatre and Hotel], ''[http://www.nps.gov/archive/klse/hrs/hrstoc.htm Hard Drive to the Klondike: Promoting Seattle During the Gold Rush]'', Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park, National Park Service. Accessed December 22, 2007.</ref> is still going strong as of 2007.
==Notes== {{reflist}}
==External links== {{commons category|John Cort (impresario)}} * {{IBDB name}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cort, John}} [[Category:American theatre managers and producers]] [[Category:Impresarios]] [[Category:Businesspeople from New York City]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Seattle]] [[Category:1861 births]]<!-- but could be as early as 1859 --> [[Category:1929 deaths]]

{{for|the toy doll by [[Mattel]]|Ken (doll)}}
'''Ken Carson''' (November 14, 1914 – April 7, 1994) was an American entertainer primarily known for singing [[Western music (North America)|Western music]]. He was an early member of the [[Sons of the Pioneers]], appearing with that group in 22 of [[Roy Rogers]]' films. His voice was featured on their iconic recordings of [[Tumbling Tumbleweeds]] and [[Cool Water (song)|Cool Water]].<ref name="NYTObit">{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1994/04/12/obituaries/ken-carson-western-singer-79.html |title=Ken Carson, Western Singer, 79 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=1994-04-12 |accessdate=2015-01-07 }}</ref>
==Early life== Carson was born '''Hubert Paul Flatt''' on November 14, 1914 in [[Centrahoma, Oklahoma]]. When he was a few weeks old, his family moved to the oil boom town of [[Drumright, Oklahoma]], where they lived for a time in a tent. Much of his childhood was spent in [[Wichita, Kansas]], living with his maternal grandparents. It was there at age 12 or 13 that he became an accomplished musician, playing guitar and harmonica, and organizing his own band. Shortly thereafter, he and his grandparents joined his mother in the [[Los Angeles]] area, where he attended [[La Puente High School|La Puente]] and [[Garfield High School (Los Angeles County, California)|Garfield]] high schools.<ref name="BobNolan">{{cite web |url=http://bobnolan-sop.net/Biographies/The%20Story%20of%20SOP/Ken%20Carson/Ken%20Carson.htm |title=Ken Carson |work=Bob Nolan - Poet Laureate of the West |accessdate=2015-01-07 }}</ref><ref name="LATimes">{{cite news |url=http://articles.latimes.com/1994-04-12/news/mn-44927_1_ken-carson |title=Ken Carson; Cowboy Singer With the Sons of the Pioneers |work=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=1994-04-12 |accessdate=2015-01-07 }}</ref>
==Musical career== Carson's adult career began in 1932, when he was only seventeen and still performing as Hubert Flatt. After a short stint on other local radio programs, he spent nine months as a thrice-weekly performer on [[Stuart Hamblen|Stuart Hamblen's]] popular ''Family Album'' radio program, appearing with such early stars as [[Patsy Montana]]. He spent the next several years with popular groups in Los Angeles and Chicago. Ken, then billed as Shorty Carson, and two others formed a group called The Ranch Boys, which played on shows like [[Don McNeill's Breakfast Club]] and [[Garry Moore]]'s ''[[Club Matinee]]'', and which made several recordings for [[Decca Records]]. In 1934 they appeared in the [[Clark Gable]] film ''[[It Happened One Night]]'', and in 1935 they were regulars on the [[Tom Mix]] radio program, also singing the commercial jingle for Shredded Ralston. In 1938, Carson and The Ranch Boys did a promotion for one of their sponsors, riding 3,975 miles on horseback from Los Angeles to Chicago to New York.<ref name="BobNolan"/>
The Ranch Boys split up in 1941, and Carson, now known as Hugh Carson, hosted a late-night radio program on Chicago's [[WGN (AM)|WGN]]. In 1943, the Sons of the Pioneers asked him to replace one of their members who had been drafted into the army. He accepted the invitation and moved to California, working nights at a military aircraft assembly plant. He remained with the Sons of the Pioneers for four years, which were the peak years of their long run of popularity.<ref name="BobNolan"/>
After his departure, he continued as a virtuoso performer. He appeared on the radio in two episodes of [[The Great Gildersleeve]] and voiced the animated wise old owl in Disney's 1948 live-and-animated film [[So Dear to My Heart]]. He made many singing commercials during these years. In the early 1950s, he was a regular performer on [[The Garry Moore Show]], one of the most popular TV shows of the day.<ref name="AATV">{{cite web |url=http://www.emmytvlegends.org/interviews/shows/garry-moore-show-the |title=Garry Moore Show, The |work=Archive of American Television |publisher=The Television Academy Foundation |accessdate=2015-01-07 }}</ref>
Always the consummate musician, Ken Carson mastered at least six instruments, and could write and score music of all sorts. He wrote down many of the songs that [[Bob Nolan]] sang, adding harmony and composition to Nolan's "play by ear" vocals. Carson was a skillful whistler, showing that talent on many recordings of Western songs, notably the Pioneers' ''Blue Shadows on the Trail''. He was an accomplished songwriter who also co-wrote many songs with his friends. The Sons of the Pioneers maintained that he was a better singer than [[Frank Sinatra]]. His voice was "clear as a bell', which made it difficult for him to blend in with the close harmonies often required with his group.<ref name="BobNolan"/>
==Personal life== Though he didn't speak Spanish, Carson had a perfect Spanish accent, which he is said to have picked up in high school. He was an excellent horseman, having competed in rodeos as a young man. He was an excellent golfer from his teens onward; at age 22 he won the NBC golf tournament. When he became so good as a natural left-hander, he learned to play golf right-handed. Carson sang at the wedding of [[Tricia Nixon Cox]], which he said was the highlight of his career. In 1979, he and his wife retired to [[Delray Beach, Florida]]. He continued to entertain locally, performing a wide repertoire that included songs of [[George Gershwin]], [[Cole Porter]], [[Billy Joel]], and [[Stevie Wonder]], as well as Western music.<ref name="BobNolan"/>
== References == {{Reflist}}
== External links == * [http://kencarsontribute.wordpress.com/ Ken Carson Tribute website] * [http://www.allmusic.com/artist/ken-carson-mn0000074544/biography Ken Carson biography at ALLMUSIC.com]

revision.text:
{{more footnotes|date=October 2011}} {{one source|date=October 2011}} The following is a '''list of arts and entertainment venues in [[Singapore]]'''.

page.title: List of webcomics with LGBT characters

revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/2607:FEA8:9260:24B:3581:BA0E:B140:418|2607:FEA8:9260:24B:3581:BA0E:B140:418]] ([[User talk:2607:FEA8:9260:24B:3581:BA0E:B140:418|talk]]): not providing a [[WP:RS|reliable source]] ([[WP:CITE]], [[WP:RS]]) ([[WP:HG|HG]]) (3.4.4)
revision.text:
{{see also|Gender and webcomics}} [[File:Girly Chapter 15 Title Page.jpg|thumb|right|''[[Girly]]'' (2003–2010)]] {{Dynamic list|date=January 2016}} This is a list of some of the many [[webcomics]] featuring [[lesbian]], [[gay]], [[bisexual]] and [[transgender]] (LGBT) content.
==Background== [[LGBT]] themes and characters were historically omitted intentionally from the content of [[comic strips]] and [[comic books]], due to either [[censorship]] or the perception that comics were for children. In recent years, the number of LGBT characters in mainstream comics has increased greatly.
There exist a large amount of openly gay and lesbian comic creators that self-publish their work on the internet. These include amateur works, as well as more "mainstream" works, such as ''[[Kyle's Bed & Breakfast]]''.<ref name=AfterElton>{{cite web|url=http://afterelton.com/print/2006/10/gaycomics.html?page=0,2 |website=[[AfterEllen.com and TheBacklot.com|AfterElton.com]] |title=Gay Comics 101 |page=3 |last=Palmer |first=Joe |date=2006-10-16 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071015095150/http://afterelton.com/print/2006/10/gaycomics.html?page=0%2C2 |archive-date=2007-10-15 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> According to Andrew Wheeler from ''[[Comics Alliance]]'', webcomics "provide a platform to so many queer voices that might otherwise go undiscovered."<ref name=ComicsAlliance />
==List== {| class="wikitable sortable" width="100%" |- ! scope="col" width="8%" | Year(s) ! scope="col" width = "20%" | Title ! scope="col" width = "12%" | Created by ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | LGBT-related content |- | 1983–2008 | scope="row" | ''[[Dykes to Watch Out For]]'' | {{sortname|Alison|Bechdel}} | Features multiple lesbian characters. |- | 1996–2007 | scope="row" | ''[[Bruno (webcomic)|Bruno]]'' | {{sortname|Christopher|Baldwin}} | The titular character is bisexual and a minor character is transgender.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Holmes|first1=Veronica|title=Bisexual Comic Strip Heroine ''Bruno''|url=http://www.afterellen.com/Print/2006/7/bruno.html|website=[[AfterEllen]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060704133745/http://www.afterellen.com/Print/2006/7/bruno.html|archivedate=July 4, 2006|date=July 3, 2006}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Davis|first1=Lauren|title=Everything You Ever Wanted to Learn About Sex from Webcomics (But Were Afraid to Ask)|url=http://comicsalliance.com/webcomics-sex/|website=ComicsAlliance|date=February 20, 2012}}</ref> |- | 1998–present | scope="row" | ''[[Jane's World]]'' | {{sortname|Paige|Braddock}} | Most of the central characters, including the titular Jane, are lesbians.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.clydefitchreport.com/2013/10/paige-braddock-changes-the-world-without-bending-or-breaking-it/|publisher=''The Clyde Fitch Report''|title=Paige Braddock Changes the World Without Bending or Breaking It|last=Sen|first=Jai|date=2013-10-18|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140108153217/http://www.clydefitchreport.com/2013/10/paige-braddock-changes-the-world-without-bending-or-breaking-it/|archivedate=2014-01-08|df=}}</ref> |- | 1998–present | scope="row" | ''[[Kyle's Bed & Breakfast]]'' | {{sortname|Greg|Fox|nolink=1}} | Covers controversial LGBT topics such as [[marriage equality]], [[HIV/AIDS]], [[body fascism]] and [[conversion therapy]].<ref name=AfterElton /><ref name=Queerty /> |- | 2001–2014 | scope="row" | ''Venus Envy'' | {{sortname|Erin|Lindsay|nolink=1}} | Features MtF transsexual character adjusting to school life as a girl. Also features an FtM transsexual and a lesbian.<ref name=gendercentre>{{cite web|last1=Seabrook|first1=Laura|title=Trans Web Comics - Transition Stories, Switch-Around, Personal Histories, Theory, Incidentals and Gag Strips|url=http://www.gendercentre.org.au/resources/polare-archive/archived-articles/trans-web-comics.htm|website=Gender Centre|accessdate=5 January 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304091742/http://www.gendercentre.org.au/resources/polare-archive/archived-articles/trans-web-comics.htm|archivedate=4 March 2016|df=}}</ref> |- | 2002–present | scope="row" | ''Closetspace'' | {{sortname|Jenn|Dolari|nolink=1}} | Features several transgender characters.<ref name=gendercentre /> |- | 2002–2009 | scope="row" | ''[[Oh My Gods!]]'' | {{sortname|Shivian|Balaris|nolink=1}} | Includes gay main characters. |- | 2002–2006<ref>{{cite web|last1=Cronin|first1=Brian|title=A Month of Good LGBT Comics - Young Bottoms in Love - CBR|url=http://www.cbr.com/a-month-of-good-lgbt-comics-young-bottoms-in-love/|website=[[Comic Book Resources]]|date=2008-11-08|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170214183118/http://www.cbr.com/a-month-of-good-lgbt-comics-young-bottoms-in-love/|archivedate=2017-02-14|df=}}</ref> | scope="row" | ''Young Bottoms in Love'' | {{sortname|Tim|Fish}} | Features "more realistic" portrayals of homosexual characters.<ref name=ComicsAlliance /> |- | 2003–2009 | scope="row" | ''DAR!'' | {{sortname|Erika|Moen}} | Moen's auto-biographical comic follows her as she explores her own sexuality.<ref name=ComicsAlliance /> |- | 2003–2010 | scope="row" | ''[[Girly]]'' | {{sortname|Josh|Lesnick|nolink=1}} | Features two women in a romantic relationship.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Kim|first1=Christina|title=The Internet is for Representation: Queer Heroes of Webcomics|url=http://thegeekiary.com/the-internet-is-for-representation-queer-heroes-of-webcomics/550|website=The Geekiary|date=2013-03-25|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161113192749/http://thegeekiary.com/the-internet-is-for-representation-queer-heroes-of-webcomics/550|archivedate=2016-11-13|df=}}</ref> |- | 2003–present | scope="row" | ''[[Questionable Content]]'' | {{sortname|Jeph|Jacques}} | Includes transgender woman Claire, as well as themes of sexuality.<ref name=MarySue /> |- | 2004–2015 | scope="row" | ''[[Girls With Slingshots]]'' | {{sortname|Danielle|Corsetto|nolink=1}} | Main character Hazel surrounds herself with various LGBT friends.<ref name=Queerty /><ref name=ComicsAlliance /> |- | 2005–present | scope="row" | ''[[Gunnerkrigg Court]]'' | {{sortname|Tom|Siddell|nolink=1}} | Features various LGBT characters, including a same-sex couple.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.themarysue.com/interview-gunnerkrigg-court-tom-siddell/|publisher=''[[The Mary Sue]]''|title=Webcomic Spotlight: Interview With Gunnerkrigg Court Creator Tom Siddell|last=Townsend|first=Alex|date=2015-11-20|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160105231105/http://www.themarysue.com/interview-gunnerkrigg-court-tom-siddell/|archivedate=2016-01-05|df=}}</ref> |- | 2005–present | scope="row" | ''Transe-Generation'' | {{sortname|Matt|Nishi|nolink=1}} | Gag strips about the daily life of an FtM transsexual.<ref name=gendercentre /> |- | 2006–2013 | scope="row" | ''Finn and Charlie are Hitched'' | {{sortname|Tony|Breed|nolink=1}} | Features a gay couple in a [[slice-of-life]] story.<ref name=Queerty /> |- | 2006–2013 | scope="row" | ''Khaos Komix'' | {{sortname|Tab|Kimpton|nolink=1}} | Features eight college kids of various sexualities and gender identities.<ref name=Queerty /><ref name=SequentialTart /> |- | 2007–2015 | scope="row" | ''Capitol Hillbillies'' | {{sortname|Chris|Lange|nolink=1}} | Revolves around the lives of four queer men.<ref name=Queerty>{{cite web|url=http://www.queerty.com/strip-tease-7-queer-web-comics-you-should-be-reading-20120917|publisher=''[[Queerty]]''|title=Strip Tease: 7 Queer Web Comics You Should Be Reading|last=Grabowy|first=TJ|date=2012-09-17|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304113703/http://www.queerty.com/strip-tease-7-queer-web-comics-you-should-be-reading-20120917|archivedate=2016-03-04|df=}}</ref> |- | 2008–present | scope="row" | ''Curvy'' | {{sortname|Sylvan|Migdal|nolink=1}} | Features two lesbian protagonists in a relationship.<ref name=ComicsAlliance>{{cite web|url=http://comicsalliance.com/comics-pride-month-50-most-important-lgbt-comics-characters/ |publisher=''[[Comics Alliance]]'' |title=Comics Pride: 50 Comics and Characters That Resonate with LGBT |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140326142201/http://comicsalliance.com/comics-pride-month-50-most-important-lgbt-comics-characters/ |archivedate=2014-03-26 |df= }}</ref> |- | 2008–present | scope="row" | ''[[Ménage à 3 (webcomic)|Ménage à 3]]'' | {{sortname|Gisele|Lagace}}; {{nowrap|Dave Lumsdon}} | Explores "themes of sexual awakening"<ref name=SequentialTart /> |- | 2008–present | scope="row" | ''[[Oglaf]]'' | {{sortname|Trudy|Cooper|nolink=1}} | Explores various sexual themes.<ref name=SequentialTart /> |- | 2008–present | scope="row" | ''Sister Claire'' | | {{sortname|Elena|Barbarich|nolink=1}}; {{nowrap|Ash Barnes}} | Includes transgender nun Oscar, and other LGBT characters.<ref>{{cite web|first=Nataya|last=Culler|title="Sister Claire," The Story of a Nun Who Puts the "R" in Representation.|url=http://www.videshimagazine.com/sister-claire-the-story-of-a-nun-who-puts-the-r-in-representation/|website=Videshi Magazine|date=2014-03-31|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170212165026/http://www.videshimagazine.com/sister-claire-the-story-of-a-nun-who-puts-the-r-in-representation/|archivedate=2017-02-12|df=}}</ref> |- | 2008–present | scope="row" | ''Starfighter'' | | {{sortname|Michelle|Palumbo|nolink=1}} | Features a sexual relationship between men.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Romano|first1=Aja|title=Behind the "Homestuck"|url=https://www.autostraddle.com/bisexual-trolls-and-non-binary-sprites-the-power-of-lgbtq-visibility-in-homestuck-337216/|website=[[Autostraddle]]|date=2016-05-24|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170213164710/https://www.autostraddle.com/bisexual-trolls-and-non-binary-sprites-the-power-of-lgbtq-visibility-in-homestuck-337216/|archivedate=2017-02-13|df=}}</ref> ''The Princess'' | {{sortname|Christine|Smith|nolink=1}} | Sports a transgender protagonist, among various other LGBT characters.<ref name=MarySue>{{cite |- | 2011–present | scope="row" | ''ChaosLife'' | {{sortname|A.|Stiffler|nolink=1}}; {{nowrap|K. Copeland}} | Semi-autobiographical comic about a queer couple.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Rude|first1=Mey|title=ChaosLife, Adorable Queer Couple Comic: The Autostraddle Interview|url=https://www.autostraddle.com/chaoslife-adorable-queer-couple-comic-the-autostraddle-interview-212199/|website=Autostraddle|date=2013-12-11|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170213165152/https://www.autostraddle.com/chaoslife-adorable-queer-couple-comic-the-autostraddle-interview-212199/|archivedate=2017-02-13|df=}}</ref> |- |2011–present |''[[Cucumber Quest]]'' | {{sortname|Gigi|D.G.|nolink=1}} |Features two crushing girls and a complex trans woman character.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Rude|first1=Mey|title=Drawn to Comics: Cucumber Quest Is the Adorable All-Ages Fantasy You Need to Read|url=https://www.autostraddle.com/drawn-to-comics-cucumber-quest-is-the-all-ages-fantasy-you-need-to-read-now-369081/|website=[[Autostraddle]]|date=February 14, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last1=Finn|first1=Charlotte|url=http://comicsalliance.com/lost-in-transition-cucumber-quest/|title=Lost in Transition: 'Cucumber Quest' and Transgender Villains|website=Comics Alliance|date=2016-05-24|access-date=2016-10-20|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161020110632/http://comicsalliance.com/lost-in-transition-cucumber-quest/|archivedate=2016-10-20|df=}}</ref> |- | 2011–present | scope="row" | ''[[Sunstone (comics)|Sunstone]]'' | {{sortname|Stjepan|Šejić||Sejic, Stjepan}} | Focuses on the [[BDSM]] relationship between two women. |- | 2012–present | scope="row" | ''As the Crow Flies'' | {{sortname|Melanie|Gillman}} | Follows the interactions of a group of queer pre-teens.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://comicsalliance.com/readers-guide-as-the-crow-flies/ |publisher=''Comics Alliance'' |title=Growing Up Queer: Should You Be Reading 'As the Crow Flies'? |last=Bezner |first=KM |date=2015-09-28 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160125054454/http://comicsalliance.com/readers-guide-as-the-crow-flies/ |archivedate=2016-01-25 |df= }}</ref> |- | 2012–present | scope="row" | ''Kate or Die'' | {{sortname|Kate|Leth}} | Covers issues including bisexuality and [[feminism]].<ref name=ComicsAlliance /> |- | 2012–present | ''O Human Star'' | {{sortname|Blue|Delliquanti|nolink=1}} | Main characters include gay men and a MtF trans robot.<ref>{{cite web|author1=Mey|title=Come Get Your Fill of Queer Robots With "O Human Star"|url=https://www.autostraddle.com/come-get-your-fill-of-queer-robots-with-o-human-star-206337/|website=Autostraddle|date=November 20, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Morris|first1=Steve|title=Blue Delliquanti Brings 'O Human Star' Volume Two To Life|url=http://comicsalliance.com/blue-delliquanti-o-human-star-volume-two-interview/|website=ComicsAlliance|date=October 19, 2016}}</ref> |- | 2012–present | scope="row" | ''The Young Protectors'' | {{sortname|Alex|Woolfson}} | Follows a gay teen superhero.{{r|Queerty}} |- | 2013–present | scope="row" | ''[[Check, Please!
